Commandment: Know there is a God
Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides God
Know that God is One, a complete Unity
Love God
Fear God reverently
Sanctify God's Name
Do not profane God's Name
Do not destroy objects associated with God's Name
Listen to the prophet speaking in God's Name
Do not test God unduly
Emulate God's ways
Cleave to those who know God (and His Law)
Love other covenant members
Show love towards foreigners
Do not hate fellow covenant members
Reprove a neighbor who sins
Do not embarrass others
Do not oppress the stranger
Do not gossip about others
Do not take revenge
Do not bear a grudge
Learn the Law (Torah)
Honor the wise and the aged (who know and teach God's Law)
Do not inquire into idolatry
Do not follow the whims of your heart or what your eyes see
Do not curse God
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship God
Do not make an idol for yourself
Do not make an idol for others
Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not turn a city to idolatry
Burn a city that has turned to idol worship
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city that has been burned
Do not derive benefit from an idolatrous city
Do not entice an individual to idol worship
Do not love those who entice others into idolatry
Do not cease hating an idolater
Do not save an idolater from execution
Do not say anything in an idolater's defense
Do not refrain from incriminating an idolater
Do not prophesy in the name of idolatry
Do not listen to a false prophet
Do not prophesy falsely in the name of God
Do not be afraid of killing the false prophet
Do not swear in the name of an idol
Do not inquire of spirits
Do not consult magicians or seers
Do not pass your children through the fire to Molech
Do not erect a pillar in a public place of worship
Do not bow down on smooth stone
Do not plant a tree in the Temple courtyard
Destroy idols and their accessories
Do not derive benefit from idols and their accessories
Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols
Do not make a covenant with idolaters
Do not show favor to idolaters
Do not let idolaters dwell in the Land of Israel
Do not imitate idolaters in customs and clothing
Do not be superstitious
Do not go into a trance to foresee events, etc
Do not engage in astrology
Do not mutter incantations
Do not attempt to contact the dead
Do not consult ghosts or spirits
Do not consult magicians or wizards
Do not perform acts of magic
Men must not shave the hair off the sides of their head
Men must not shave their beards with a razor
Men must not wear women's clothing
Women must not wear men's clothing
Do not tattoo the skin
Do not tear or cut the skin in mourning
Do not make a bald spot in mourning
Repent and confess wrongdoings
Recite the Shema twice daily
Serve the Almighty [traditionally: with daily prayer]
The priests must bless the Israelite nation daily
Wear tefillin (phylacteries) on the head
Bind tefillin on the arm
Put the commandments on each door post
Each male must write a scroll of the Law
The king must have a separate book of the Law for himself
Have tzitzit on four-cornered garments
Bless the Almighty after eating
Circumcise all males on the eighth day after their birth
Rest on the seventh day Sabbath
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
The court must not inflict punishment on the Sabbath
Do not walk outside the city boundary on the Sabbath
Sanctify the Sabbath (in speech) from beginning to end
Do not do prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement
Rest from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement
Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement
Do not eat or drink on the Day of Atonement
Rest on the first day of Passover
Do not do prohibited labor on the first day of Passover
Rest on the seventh day of Passover
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day of Passover
Rest on the Feast of Weeks
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Weeks
Rest on the Feast of Trumpets
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Trumpets
Rest on the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not do prohibited labor on the first day of the Feast of Tabernacles
Rest on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not do prohibited labor on the last day of the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not eat leavened food on the afternoon of the 14th day of Nisan
Destroy all leaven on 14th day of Nisan
Do not eat leaven all seven days of Passover
Do not eat mixtures containing leaven all seven days of Passover
Do not see leaven in your domain seven days during Passover
Do not find leaven in your domain seven days during Passover
Eat unleavened bread on the first night of Passover
Relate the Exodus from Egypt on the fIrst night Passover
Hear the ram's horn on the Feast of Trumpets
Dwell in a temporary shelter for the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
Each male Israelite must give a half shekel annually
The month of Passover (Nisan) shall be the first month
Sound the ram's horn when going to war
Marry a wife by means of a marriage agreement and sanctification
Do not have sexual relations with women not married by means of a marriage agreement and sanctification
Do not withhold food, clothing, and sexual relations from your wife
Have children with one's wife
Issue a divorce by means of a "get" document
A man must not remarry his ex-wife after she has married someone else
A man must marry the widow of his childless brother
A man must free the widow of his childless brother from the obligation to marry him if he is unwilling to marry her
A childless widow must not remarry until the ties with her brother-in-law are removed
The court must fine one who sexually seduces a maiden
One who seduces a maiden must marry the maiden if she chooses
A seducer that marries the maiden he seduces must not divorce her
A man who slanders his wife with accusations of adultery must remain married to his wife
A man who slanders his wife with accusations of adultery must not divorce her
Fulfill the laws of the woman suspected of adultery
Do not put oil on the meal offering of a woman suspected of adultery
Do not put frankincense on the meal offering of a woman suspected of adultery
Do not have sexual relations with your mother
Do not have sexual relations with your father's wife
Do not have sexual relations with your sister
Do not have sexual relations with your father's wife's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with your son's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with your daughter
Do not have sexual relations with your daughter's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter
Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her son's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with your father's sister
Do not have sexual relations with your mother's sister
Do not have sexual relations with your father's brother's wife
Do not have sexual relations with your son's wife
Do not have sexual relations with your brother's wife
Do not have sexual relations with your wife's sister
A man must not have sexual relations with an animal
A woman must not have sexual relations with an animal
Do not have homosexual sexual relations
Do not have homosexual sexual relations with your father
Do not have homosexual sexual relations with your father's brother
Do not have sexual relations with someone else's wife
Do not have sexual relations with a menstrually impure woman
Do not marry those who are not members of the Covenant
Do not let Moabite and Ammonite males marry into the Covenant people
Do not prevent a third-generation Egyptian convert from marrying into the Covenant people
Do not refrain from marrying a third generation Edomite convert
Do not let a child born due to an illegal relationship marry into the Covenant people
Do not let a eunuch marry into the Covenant people
Do not offer to God any castrated male animals
The high priest must not marry a widow
The high priest must not have sexual relations with a widow even outside of marriage
The high priest must marry a virgin maiden
A priest must not marry a divorcee
A priest must not marry a woman who has had a forbidden sexual relationship
A priest must not marry a desecrated woman
Do not make pleasurable (sexual) contact with any forbidden woman
Examine the signs of animals to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher
Examine the signs of fowl to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher
Examine the signs of fish to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher
Examine the signs of insects to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher
Do not eat non-kosher animals
Do not eat non-kosher fowl
Do not eat non-kosher fish
Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
Do not eat non-kosher creatures that crawl on land
Do not eat non-kosher vermin
Do not eat worms found in fruit on the ground
Do not eat creatures that live in water other than kosher fish
Do not eat of an animal that dies of natural causes
Do not benefit from an ox condemned to be stoned
Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded
Do not eat meat torn off a living creature
Do not eat blood
Do not eat certain fats of clean animals
Do not eat the sinew of the thigh
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
Do not cook meat and milk together
Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat parched grains from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat ripened grains from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat fruit of a tree during its first three years
Do not eat diverse seeds planted in a vineyard
Do not eat untithed fruits
Do not drink wine poured in service to idols
Ritually slaughter an animal before eating it
Do not slaughter an animal and its offspring on the same day
Cover the blood of a slaughtered beast or fowl with earth
Do not take a mother bird with its children
Release a mother bird before taking her children from the nest
Do not swear falsely in God's Name
Do not take God's Name in vain
Do not deny possession of something entrusted to you
Do not falsely swear in denial of a claim to property
Swear in God's Name to confirm the truth when deemed necessary by court
Fulfill what you uttered and do what you vowed
Do not break oaths or vows
For oaths and vows annulled, there are the laws of annulling vows explicit in the Law
The nazarite must let his hair grow
The nazarite must not cut his hair
The nazarite must not drink wine, wine mixtures, or wine vinegar
The nazarite must not eat fresh grapes
The nazarite must not eat raisins
The nazarite must not eat grape seeds
The nazarite must not eat grape skins
The nazarite must not be under the same roof as a corpse
The nazarite must not come into contact with the dead
The nazarite must shave his head after bringing sacrifices upon completion of his nazarite period
Estimate the value of people as determined by the Law
Estimate the value of consecrated animals
Estimate the value of consecrated houses
Estimate the value of consecrated fields
Carry out the laws of interdicting possessions
Do not sell interdicted possessions
Do not redeem interdicted possessions
Do not plant diverse seeds together
Do not plant grains or greens in a vineyard
Do not crossbreed animals
Do not work different animals together
Do not wear cloth woven of wool and linen
Leave a corner of the field uncut for the poor
Do not reap the corner of a field left for the poor
Leave gleanings of a field for the poor
Do not gather gleanings of a crop but leave them for the poor
Leave the gleanings of a vineyard for the poor
Do not gather the gleanings of a vineyard but leave them for the poor
Leave the unformed clusters of grapes for the poor
Do not pick the unformed clusters of grapes but leave them for the poor
Leave the forgotten sheaves in the field for the poor
Do not retrieve sheaves forgotten in the field but leave them for the poor
Separate the tithe for the poor
Give charity to those in need
Do not withhold charity from the poor
Set aside a gift of food for the priest
The Levite must set aside a tenth of his tithe for the priest
Do not preface one tithe to the next, but separate them in their proper order
A non- priest must not eat food set aside as a gift for the priest
A hired worker or an Israelite bondsman of a priest must not eat food set aside as a gift for the priest
An uncircumcised priest must not eat food set aside for a priest
An impure priest must not eat food set aside for a priest
A desecrated woman must not eat food set aside for a priest
Set aside a tithe each planting year and give it to a Levite
Set aside the second tithe
Do not spend the money from selling the second tithe on anything but food, drink, or ointment in Jerusalem
Do not eat the second tithe while impure
A mourner on the first day after a death must not eat the second tithe
Do not eat second tithe grains outside Jerusalem
Do not eat second tithe wine products outside Jerusalem
Do not eat second tithe oil outside Jerusalem
The fourth year crops must be totally for holy purposes like the second tithe
Read the confession of tithes every fourth and seventh year
Set aside the first fruits and bring them to the Temple
The priests must not eat the first fruits outside Jerusalem
Read the portion of Scripture pertaining to the presentation of first fruits
Set aside a portion of dough for a priest
Give the shoulder, two cheeks, and stomach of a slaughtered animals to a priest
Give the first shearing of sheep to a priest
Redeem firstborn sons and give the money to a priest
Redeem the firstborn donkey by giving a lamb to a priest
Break the neck of the donkey if the owner does not intend to redeem it
The land shall rest unworked during the seventh year
Do not work the land during the seventh year
Do not work with trees to produce fruit during the seventh year
Do not reap crops that grow wild during the seventh year in the normal manner
Do not gather grapes which grow wild during the seventh year in the normal way
Leave free all produce which grew in the seventh year
Release all loans during the seventh year
Do not pressure or claim from the borrower during the seventh year
Do not refrain from lending immediately before the release of the loans for fear of monetary loss
The Sanhedrin must count seven groups of seven years
The Sanhedrin must sanctify the fiftieth year
Blow the ram's horn on the tenth day of the seventh month to free the slaves
Do not work the soil during the fiftieth year
Do not reap in the normal manner that which grows wild in the fiftieth year
Do not pick grapes which grew wild in the normal manner in the fiftieth year
Carry out the laws of sold family properties in the fiftieth year
Do not sell the land in Israel indefinitely
Carry out the laws of houses in walled cities
The Tribe of Levi must not be given a portion of the land in Israel
The Levites must not take a share in the spoils of war
Give the Levites cities to inhabit and their surrounding fields
Do not sell the fields of the Levites but they shall belong to Levites before and after the Jubilee year
Build a Sanctuary (Tabernacle-Temple)
Do not build the altar with stones hewn by metal
Do not climb steps to the altar
Show reverence to the Temple
Guard the Temple area
Do not leave the Temple unguarded
Prepare the anointing oil
Do not reproduce the anointing oil
Do not anoint a foreigner with anointing oil
Do not reproduce the incense formula
Do not burn anything on the Golden Altar besides incense
The Levites must transport the ark on their shoulders
Do not remove the staves from the ark
The Levites must work in the Temple
No Levite must do the work of either another priest or another Levite
Dedicate the priest for service
The work of the priests' shifts must be equal during holidays
The priests must wear their priestly garments during service
Do not tear the priestly garments
Do not loosen the breastplate from the ephod
A priest must not enter the Temple intoxicated
A priest must not enter the Temple with his head uncovered
A priest must not enter the Temple with torn clothes
A priest must not enter the sanctuary of the Temple indiscriminately
A priest must not leave the Temple during service
Send the impure person from the Temple
An impure person must not enter the Temple
An impure person must not enter the Temple Mount area
Impure priests must not do service in the Temple
An impure priest, following immersion, shall not serve until after sundown
A priest must wash his hands and feet before service
A priest with a physical blemish must not enter the sanctuary or approach the altar
A priest with a physical blemish must not serve
A priest with a temporary blemish must not serve
One who is not a priest must not serve
Offer only unblemished animals
Do not dedicate a blemished animal for the altar
Do not slaughter a blemished animal
Do not sprinkle a blemished animal's blood
Do not burn a blemished animal's fat
Do not offer a temporarily blemished animal
Do not sacrifice blemished animals even if offered by those who are not part of the Covenant
Do not inflict wounds upon dedicated animals
To redeem dedicated animals which have become disqualified
Offer only animals which are at least eight days old
Do not offer animals bought with the wages of a harlot or the wages of a dog
Do not burn honey or yeast on the altar
Salt all sacrifices
Do not omit the salt from sacrifices
Carry out the procedure of the burnt offering as prescribed in the Law
Do not eat the meat of an offering away from the Temple
Carry out the procedure of the sin offering
Do not eat the meat of the inner sin offering
Do not decapitate a fowl brought as a sin offering
Carry out the procedure of the guilt offering
The priests must eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple
The priests must not eat the meat outside the Temple courtyard
A non- priest must not eat certain sacrificial meat
Follow the procedure of the peace offering
Do not eat the meat of minor sacrifices before sprinkling the blood
Bring meal offerings as prescribed in the Torah
Do not put oil on the meal offerings of wrongdoers
Do not put frankincense on the meal offerings of wrongdoers
Do not eat the meal offering of a priest
Do not bake a meal offering as leavened bread
The priests must eat the remains of the meal offerings
Bring all avowed and freewill offerings to the Temple on the first subsequent festival
Do not withhold payment incurred by any vow
Offer all sacrifices in the Temple
Bring all sacrifices from outside Israel to the Temple
Do not slaughter sacrifices outside the Temple
Do not offer any sacrifices outside the courtyard
Offer two lambs for sacrifice every day
Keep the fire burning on the altar
Do not extinguish the fire on the altar
Remove the ashes from the altar every day
Burn incense every day
Light the Menorah every day
The high priest must bring a meal offering every day
Bring two additional lambs as burnt offerings on the Sabbath
Make the show bread and place it before God
Bring additional offerings on the first day of the month
Bring additional offerings on Passover
Offer the wave offering from the meal of the new wheat
Each man must count seven weeks from the day the new wheat offering was brought after Passover
Bring additional offerings on the Feast of Weeks
Bring two loaves to accompany the additional the Feast of Weeks offerings
Bring additional offerings on the Feast of Trumpets
Bring additional offerings on the Day of Atonement
Bring additional offerings on the Feast of Tabernacles
Bring additional offerings on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not eat sacrifices which have become unfit or blemished
Do not eat from sacrifices offered with improper intentions
Do not leave sacrifices past the time allowed for eating them
Do not eat from that which was left over from an offering
Do not eat from sacrifices which became impure
An impure person must not eat from sacrifices
Burn the leftover sacrifices
Burn all impure sacrifices
Follow the procedures of the Day of Atonement in the sequence prescribed
One who profaned a sacred object must repay what he profaned plus a fifth and bring a sacrifice
Do not work consecrated animals
Do not shear the fleece of consecrated animals
Slaughter the paschal sacrifice at the specified time
Do not slaughter the paschal sacrifice while in possession of leaven
Do not leave the fat of the paschal sacrifice overnight
Slaughter the second Passover lamb
Eat the Passover lamb with unleavened bread and bitter herbs on the night of the 14th of Nisan
Eat the second Passover lamb on the night of the 15th day of the month after Passover
Do not eat the meat of the Passover lamb raw or boiled
Do not take the meat of the Passover lamb from the confines of the group
An apostate must not eat from the Passover lamb
A permanent or temporary hired worker must not eat from the Passover lamb
An uncircumcised male must not eat from the Passover lamb
Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb
Do not break any bones from the second Passover lamb offering
Do not leave any meat of the Passover lamb over until morning
Do not leave the meat of the second Passover lamb over until morning
Do not leave the meat of the Passover lamb of the 14th until the 16th
Go to the Temple on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles
Celebrate on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles and bring a peace offering
Rejoice on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles and bring a peace offering
Do not appear at the Temple during Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles without offerings
Do not refrain from rejoicing with, and giving gifts to, the Levites on the Pilgrimage Festivals
Assemble all the people on the Feast of Tabernacles following the seventh year
Set aside the firstborn animals
The priests must not eat unblemished firstborn animals outside Jerusalem
Do not redeem the firstborn animals
Separate the tithe of animals
Do not redeem the tithe
Every person must bring a sin offering for his transgression
Bring an asham offering when uncertain of guilt
Bring an offering when guilt is determined for certain sins
Bring an offering in accordance with one's financial ability
The High Court must bring an offering when it rules in error
A woman who had a running vaginal issue must bring an offering in the Temple after she immerses in water
A woman who gave birth must bring an offering after she immerses in water
A man who had a running unnatural urinary issue must bring an offering in the Temple after he immerses in water
An leprous person must bring an offering after immersing in water
Do not substitute another beast for one set apart for sacrifice
Both an animal offered as a substitution as well as an animal set apart for sacrifice retain their consecration
Do not change consecrated animals from one type of offering to another
Carry out the laws of impurity of the dead
Carry out the procedure of the Red Heifer
Carry out the laws of the sprinkling water
Follow the commandments of human leprosy as prescribed in the Law
The unclean person must not remove his signs of impurity
The leprous person must not shave signs of impurity in his hair
The leprous person must publicize his condition by tearing his garments, allowing his hair to grow and covering his lips
Carry out the prescribed rules for purifying the leprous person
The leprous person must shave off all his hair prior to purification
Carry out the laws of leprous clothing
Carry out the laws of leprous houses
Observe the laws of menstrual impurity
Observe the laws of impurity caused by childbirth
Observe the laws of impurity caused by a woman's running issue
Observe the laws of impurity caused by a man's running issue
Observe the laws of impurity caused by a dead beast
Observe the laws of impurity caused by the eight listed creatures
Observe the laws of impurity of a seminal emission
Observe the laws of impurity concerning liquid and solid foods
Every impure person must immerse himself in water to become pure
The court must judge the damages incurred by a goring ox
The court must judge the damages incurred by an animal eating
The court must judge the damages incurred by a pit
The court must judge the damages incurred by fire
Do not steal money by lying
The court must implement punitive measures against a thief
Each individual must ensure that his scales and weights are accurate
Do not commit injustice with scales and weights
Do not possess inaccurate scales and weights even if they are not for use
Do not move a boundary marker to steal someone's property
Do not kidnap
Do not rob
Do not withhold wages or fail to repay a debt
Do not covet and scheme to acquire another's possession
Do not desire another's possession
Return a stolen object or its value
Do not ignore a lost object
Return the lost object
The court must implement laws against the one who assaults another or damages another's property
Do not murder
Do not accept monetary restitution to atone for a murderer
The court must send the accidental murderer to a city of refuge
Do not accept monetary restitution instead of being sent to a city of refuge
Do not kill a murderer before he stands trial
Save someone from being killed by a blood avenger even by taking the life of the pursuer
Do not pity a person who pursues an individual accused of murder
Do not stand idly by if someone's life is in danger
Designate cities of refuge and prepare routes of access
Break the neck of a calf by the river valley following an unsolved murder
Do not work nor plant the river valley where an unsolved murder occurred
Do not allow pitfalls and obstacles to remain on your property
Make a guard rail around flat roofs
Do not put a stumbling block before a blind man
Help another remove the load from a beast which can no longer carry it
Help others load their beast
Do not leave others distraught with their burdens (but to help either load or unload)
Buy and sell according to God's Law
Do not overcharge or underpay for an article
Do not insult or harm anybody with words
Do not cheat a foreigner monetarily
Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
Purchase a Hebrew slave in accordance with the prescribed laws
Do not sell a Hebrew as a non-Hebrew is sold
Do not work a Hebrew slave oppressively
Do not allow a non-Israelite to work a Hebrew slave oppressively
Do not have a Hebrew slave do menial slave labor
Give a Hebrew slave gifts when he goes free
Do not send a Hebrew slave away empty-handed
Redeem Israelite maidservants
Betroth the Israelite maidservant
The master must not sell his maidservant
Canaanite slaves must work forever unless injured in one of their limbs
Do not extradite a slave who fled to the Land of Israel
Do not wrong a slave who has come to the Land of Israel for refuge
The courts must carry out the laws of a hired worker and hired guard
Pay wages on the day they were earned
Do not delay payment of wages past the agreed time
The hired worker may eat from the unharvested crops where he works
The worker must not eat while on hired time
The worker must not take more than he can eat
Do not muzzle an ox while plowing
The courts must carry out the laws of a borrower
The courts must carry out the laws of an unpaid guard
Lend to the poor and destitute
Do not press the poor and destitute for payment if you know they don't have it
Press the idolater for payment of a loan
The creditor must not forcibly take collateral
Return the collateral to the debtor when needed
Do not delay return of collateral when needed
Do not demand collateral from a widow
Do not demand as collateral utensils needed for preparing food
Do not lend with interest
Do not borrow with interest
Do not intermediate in an interest loan, guarantee, witness, or write the promissory note
Lend to and borrow from idolaters with interest
The courts must carry out the laws of the plaintiff, admitter, or denier
Carry out the laws of the order of inheritance
Appoint judges
Do not appoint judges who are not familiar with the Law
Decide by majority in case of disagreement
The court must not execute through a majority of one; at least a majority of two is required
A judge who presented an acquittal plea must not present an argument for conviction in capital cases
The courts must carry out the death penalty of stoning
The courts must carry out the death penalty of burning
The courts must carry out the death penalty of decapitation with the sword
The courts must carry out the death penalty of strangulation
The courts must hang those stoned for blasphemy or idolatry
Bury the executed on the day they are killed
Do not delay burial overnight
The court must not let the sorcerer live
The court must give lashes to the wrongdoer
The court must not exceed the prescribed number of lashes
The court must not kill anybody on circumstantial evidence
The court must not punish anybody who was forced to do a crime
A judge must not pity the murderer or assaulter at the trial
A judge must not have mercy on the poor man at the trial
A judge must not respect the great man at the trial
A judge must not decide unjustly the case of the habitual transgressor
A judge must not pervert justice
A judge must not pervert a case involving a foreigner or orphan
Judge righteously
The judge must not fear a violent man in judgment
Judges must not accept bribes
Judges must not accept testimony unless both parties are present
Do not curse judges
Do not curse the head of state or leader of the Sanhedrin
Do not curse any upstanding Israelite
Anybody who knows evidence must testify in court
Carefully interrogate the witness
A witness must not serve as a judge in capital crimes
Do not accept testimony from a lone witness
Habitual transgressors must not testify
Relatives of the litigants must not testify
Do not testify falsely
Punish the false witnesses as they tried to punish the defendant
Act according to the ruling of the Sanhedrin
Do not deviate from the word of the Sanhedrin
Do not add any commandments to the Law
Do not diminish any commandments from the Law
Do not curse your father and mother
Do not strike your father and mother
Respect your father or mother
Fear your father or mother
Do not be a rebellious son
Mourn for relatives
The high priest must not defile himself for any relative
The high priest must not enter under the same roof as a corpse
A priest must not defile himself (by going to funerals or cemeteries) for anyone except relatives
Appoint a king from Israel
Do not appoint a foreigner as king
The king must not have too many wives
The king must not have too many horses
The king must not have too much silver and gold
Destroy the seven Canaanite nations
Do not let any of the seven Canaanite nations remain alive
Wipe out the descendants of Amalek
Remember what Amalek did to the Israelites
Do not forget Amalek's atrocities and ambush on our journey from Egypt in the desert
Do not dwell permanently in Egypt
Offer peace terms to the inhabitants of a city while holding siege, and treat them according to the Law if they accept the terms
Do not offer peace to Ammon and Moab while besieging them
Do not destroy fruit trees even during the siege
Prepare latrines outside the camps
Prepare a shovel for each soldier to dig with
Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war
He who has taken a wife, built a new home, or planted a vineyard is given a year to rejoice with his possessions
Do not demand any communal or military involvement for one year
Do not panic and retreat during battle
Keep the laws of the captive woman
Do not sell a captive woman into slavery
Do not retain a captive woman for servitude after having sexual relations with her
